reviews.sentence: Great Getaway Special Events location. I stayed at the hotel on Sunday night so that I could get up early on Monday to attend a large breakfast celebration at the hotel for MLK Day. The hotel room was clean and the king sized bed was comfortable. I especially appreciated the service at the hotel. I was helping to plan the breakfast and had to interact with the staff who were responsible for setting up the banquet room the night before the breakfast and on the day of the breakfast. The staff particularly Derrick and Jenifer consistently met our requests for small items like storing flowers in their refrigerator overnight and setting up extra tables during the breakfast itself to accommodate additional guests. So in addition to the hotel being a great place to stay it is also a great conference center for holding large events. In addition I ate at the bar and had a great Angus bacon cheeseburger.

Costly but nice. I was here for a conference and originally booked a room for two nights. After adding up all the extra costs of 1295 day for WiFi 15 for parking on top of the 120 plus taxes and 19 breakfast buffet or a la carte items and nothibg on the restaurant menu we would eat I looked elsewhere. That elsewhere was ok but now wished I would have diged a little more or paid the extra 120 to stay at the Mariot. it is beautiful. Of the staff we ran into they were very friendly. Cans of pop mini bottles of water and small cups of coffee costs 30 ea. That was outrageous. If it would have been FREE WiFi and parking at least we would have most likely stated the two nights.

Best staff I have ever dealt with. Conveniently located a block from the White Flint Metro. I have stayed here many times and the staff is the BEST at any hotel I have ever been to. Always friendly helpful and attentive. Rooms are clean and always well kept. Good food at the restaurant and a trendy little bar. The conference rooms are quiet compared to most which is very nice. Only negative is that the conference rooms downstairs are accessed by stairs and that is tough with a suitcase. There is an elevator somewhere by the conference rooms but I have never seen it. That is a small deal though and the rest of the property more than makes up for that. The concierge lounge is comfortable and a great way to get a quick bite to eat after a long day of work. Again. the staff is the greatest all the time.

Could NOT handle NUVO dance convention 22015. Not enough employees for service areas broken credit card machines in most areas had to use cash. Broken beds refrigerators. Over 3 hours for room service. Disappointed just about everyone who attended our convention. Thankful NUVO is choosing a different hotel next year.

Excellent location near a metro station which enabled easy access to all DC locations. I can not believe that a hotel and conference center such as this one is unable to offer free internet in the room especially since so many of the slightly cheaper venues already include it. Also parking should be included in the room rate.

The lobby and comona areas were very fancy in appearance hotel is a close walking distance to several area attractions staff was friendly and helpful. Parking was complicated hotel is attached to conference center with no clear signage to check in desk hotel parking room smelled stale hair in the toliet TV and hairdryer did not work bed was not terrible but gave both my husband and I a backache.
Staff greeted me at the door and showed me to my meeting. Super clean hotel. I recommend for business pleasure.

Bethesda North Mariot Hotel Conference Center. I was at the hotel for a conference. Even though I live locally it was too far to go home overnight and be back by 7 am. This is a typical Mariot. The front desk staff was great. I was expecting a delivery which had not come before I checked in. When I came back several hours later the front desk person called to me even before I got to the desk to tell me he had my delivery. The biggest problem is that the hotel rooms are a long long walk to the attached conference center. This made going back to the room very problematic. While bellman service in the hotel was fine getting bellman service in the conference center was horrible. I was surprised by the amount of noise that I could hear from outside the hotel. Even though I was on the 6th floor I could hear the trains that were several blocks away. But a nice typical large Mariot.

Nice hotel for good price. Stayed 2 nights at hotel for a dance convention. Nice hotel but very busy so wait lines for elevators were long at times. Room was a bit small but comfortable bed. I like the late checkout 12 noon. Hotel was clean and friendly staff. Restaurant was I bit costly but tasty food choices.
Was ththere for an annual MLK Breakfast. The staff and service they provide is top notch. Would recommend it to anyone looking for a location for their functions.

Efficient for the job. I was there for NIH meetings at the Neuroscience Center. The hotel was an efficient and easy place to stay for my purposes. Everyone was gracious. The room was tidy and comfortable. Thank you.
Went to small press expo.

Great hotel but pricey during conference. Clean but pricey during conference. Avoid staying for conference. Room rate can go up to 3x or 4xFor none conference stay it is priced okSo look at room rates night by night to make sure you are getting a deal.

The staff at Starbucks and at our conference were excellent but this was the worst hotel experience I have had. Stayed in one room with a coworker and it stunk like sewer and we could not move to another room because they were fully booked. They came to the room with an ozone freshener that masked the smell. The next day we were at the conference all day and came back to the room and the smell was worse than ever and our A C was not working. The front desk gentleman was kind enough to move us to another room. Our new room looked ok. When we came back at 10pm to shower and get ready for bed we had absolutely no water pressure coming from our shower and there are nasty stains on the bed comforter chair and floor. When I called to complain all they would do is comp us breakfast and asked to come up to look at the shower but by that time it was too late. Will never come back to this hotel again. I have stayed at numerous hotels but not ever one like this. This place is gross and dumpy.
Have been here several years for Small Press Expo and it is always been a great experience. If you are going to park for an event I recommend parking at the metro stop down the road.
A tranquil area even though the event I went to was kinda crazy. Wish they had less construction going on and water availability increased.
For a conference experience their parking is horribly expensive and they make you pay for wifi. And outside wifi reception sucks in the conference area.
It was a lovely building service was very good. The parking was a bit confusing though as the garage for the conference centre is actually around the corner from the main entrance.
The conference center was fairly typical of hotel conference centers albiet a little dimly lit in some places.

If I could give no stars I would. We were here for a conference and due to the amount of people attending we had two different reservations. A single for 3 for part of the week Tuesday and Wednesday. then a double for the rest of the week when we had 5 peopleThursday to Sunday. When it was time to change rooms they told us that there were no double rooms available and we had to move to a different hotel or keep our single with 5 people. Mind you the max for singles are 3 due to fire code. So for Thursday night we had 5 in a single and was given a maybe that we would have a double for the rest of the week. We asked for blankets so our extras people could have them and was told they are in the room. I told this women I checked and we only had what was on the bed the girl said ok I will have someone check on that and never did not anything. We had to wait until a shift change to ask for blankets who without questions he I believehis name was Nicholas who was the only good employee the hotel had that we dealt with got us blankets pillows and offered his apologies because we were not the first that shift to complain adout the morning desk. The woman then tried to charge us the full price for the room instead of the conference price and agrued with us about it. We even showed them their invoice they emailed to us with the discount price. Then because we had two reservations both my husband and I got the free parking pass that the conference offersed one for each room and they would nt take it. The email we got said right into it to hand it to the desk when checking in and they told us it was not valid and we had to get the conference chair to take time out of his busy schedule of running the week long conference to tell the desk this was right. This was along on Wednesday of the week so many people we have talk to had not issues with this. Then Friday morning we had a friend who let us put our staff in their room when we checked out of the single until a room was ready. We got to the desk at 10 am and was told by Nicholas that there was a double room was ready for us. I find this hard to believe that a room was ready this early in the morning when none were last night. Someone had to check out and housekeeping had to clean up all and the computer had to be updated that the room was good all before 10 am. I think not. We also had the same women her name was something like Samantha but was spelled differently most of these issues and she was nothing but rude to us the whole week. Like I said before the night shift guy named Nicholas was the only one the whole week we did not have any problems with. If any stars are to be given he should get 10 stars for doing his job well and having to clean up after Samantha. But the biggest thing was when the power when out. Yes I know they were not the reason the hotel lost power for a few minutes but during thoses minutes I got stuck in the elevator and banged my knee off the floor from the jout of the stop. The elevator thankfully had a fail safe and it slowly bought me to the ground floor and opened without an issue. So good job on that part but when I went to tell the front desk to tell them that I was stuck in the elevator because at the time I did not know that power went out and tought it was the elevator so it can be fixed I was told we know. and he walked away. No i m sorry you got stuck in OUR elevator or asked if I was okay. Random people who were waiting for the elevator asked if I was okay when the door opened and offered me help but the staff could of cared less. What if I was there for more then a few minutes or if I hit my head. The rest of this post I can deal with but this is the safety of YOUR guest. Thank God our event is moving because I will never come back to this hotal again.

The conference floor is falling apart a bit in the main stage room. The are working on the hallway between the hotel and conference center so hoping they will get to the stage room sometime. Staff is friendly and the location is great.

Large areas are under construction. The restaurant was too small to handle our large convention. However the food was good. Our room was quiet and comfortable but the bathroom needed new fixtures. I hope it improves once construction is completed.
No one was at the front table and reparing job was going inside the building at daytime while various meetings were taking place in the hotel.

I normally do not write reviews but felt like I needed to with my experience there. I went to a work conference on 1212020 and I arrived around 11 am. Unfortunately I was not able to fit my truck in the parking garage so I looped back to the lobby and asked a gentleman named Andre if I could park in the back lot where the overnight guests park. He was very gracious to let me do so after I explained him my situation. He went above and beyond to help me out. Later that evening I called the front desk manager named Brock to let him know about my great experience with Andre. Brock was also a pleasure to deal with and even offered to put my name at the front desk to let them know in case I came back later in the week for more meetings that I could park in the overnight parking lot. He was also great. I hope Mariot headquarters and Andre and Brocks management read this. They both deserve some kudos.
